Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
long-term \long-term\ adj. same as {long-run}; as, the long-term consequences.
Syn: long-run. [WordNet 1.5]

long-term adj : relating to or extending over a relatively long time; "the long-run significance of the elections"; "the long-term reconstruction of countries damaged by the war"; "a long-term investment" [syn: {long-run}, {semipermanent}]
